title.narrative: 1.7 CHILD-CENTERED DRR - SPG

description.narrative: Strengthened national capacity in child-centered disaster risk reduction and risk-informed planning, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, there is an inclusive and protective legal and policy environment and improved state accountability for the realization of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacity in child-centered disaster risk reduction and risk-informed planning

description.narrative: With UNICEF’s support, children benefitted from a stronger government disaster risk management system for resilience. UNICEF supported developing a national guideline for 63 provinces on planning for risk reduction efforts in the COVID-19 context. UNICEF provided technical support to develop a Green Growth Strategy with a stronger focus on children, and advocating the government on net-zero emissions. UNICEF launched a multi-year project (2022-2025) to enhance children and their families’ resilience to disaster risks and climate change and to promote the engagement of children and young people in climate change actions and environmental protection. | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/02/2022
